result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Craig Curtis Waite was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $50 per month payment plan commencing by November 10, 2015. Defendant agreed to $15 payment plan fee

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Zachary Craig Curtis Waite in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the parties did have a pre-trial and an offer was provided; the defendant would like to accept that offer.  Defendant agrees.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
Defendant enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

BY THE COURT:  Pay fine and costs = $379.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in November

Defendant Zachary Craig Curtis Waite in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Court finds probable cause.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and Pre-Trial.
